thread.title: Franklin: Cool temperatures persist through the weekend
thread.title_full: Franklin: Cool temperatures persist through the weekend - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Chris Franklin, Meteorologist
title: Franklin: Cool temperatures persist through the weekend
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - A deepening upper low to our east has brought a second surge of fall weather with cooler temperatures and lower humidity.
This will keep Friday and this weekend very pleasant with sunny skies. Afternoons will be in the upper 70s and overnight lows will drop into the 50s and 60s.
Winds will remain breezy through Sunday. The upper pattern begins to shift with an upper ridge developing from the west over the region.
This will warm temperatures back into the mid and even upper 80s by next week. Hurricane Joaquin is now on a projected path away from the US East coast and should remain over the Atlantic as it moves northward.
